name: ivre
description: Install IVRE Framework (https://github.com/ivre/ivre) Client, Database and Web Dashboard
install: echo 'Waiting for cloud-init to finish, this can take a few minutes please be patient...'

sudo apt-get -qy --no-install-recommends install apache2 bash-completion bison build-essential bzip2 ca-certificates ffmpeg flex fonts-dejavu git gnupg imagemagick ipython3 libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 libfontconfig1 libfreetype6 libssl-dev mongodb nfdump openssl patch python3-bottle python3-crypto python3-cryptography python3-openssl python3-pil python3-pymongo python3-setuptools rsync s3270 screen tesseract-ocr wget -y
cd ivre/ && python3 setup.py build && sudo python3 setup.py install && cd /home/op/
sudo apt-get -q update && sudo apt-get -qy --no-install-recommends install zeek
echo 'Testing database by conducting NMAP scan against: 45.33.32.156 (scanme.nmap.org)'

cat scanme.nmap.org.json |  jq 'with_entries(if .key == "template-id" then .key = "template" else . end)' | jq 'with_entries(if .key == "matched-at" then .key = "matched" else . end)' | jq -c | tee corrrected-scanme.nmap.org.json
echo 'The IVRE / DRUNK Dynamic Recon of UNKnown Network Install Complete'
echo "run axiom-exec 'docker run -d --name ivreweb --hostname ivreweb --link ivredb:ivredb --publish 80:80 ivre/web' -i '$(hostname)'"
echo 'Then the dashboard will be publicly reachable at:'
